newsitem.title: FRANCE: Tat airline attendants plan 24-hour strike.
newsitem.headline: Tat airline attendants plan 24-hour strike.

text.p: The union representing airline attendants working for British Airways' French airline unit TAT European Airlines has called a 24-hour strike on Wednesday in protest against staffing levels.

"The hostesses and stewards of the company, 100 percent owned by British Airways, plan to protest against chronic understaffing and the uncertainty of their work contracts," the Syndicat National du Personnel Navigant Commercial said in a statement.
A union spokeswoman said the airline had some 300 flight attendants. She said the strike would start at midnight local time.
The airline's pilots held a strike earlier this month.
A spokesman for the airline could not be reached for comment.
